item.title: Task List
item.description:
To make the MVS-TK5 System a little bit closer to a “real world” environment for an “Application Programmer”:

The Application Programmer User Id will be “DSCOBOL”.

Tasks

  • Update the host environment and the MVS-TK5 System
  • Create a DASD device just for that Programmer (why? why not!)
  • Add a new USER
  • Create a starting structure of PDS’s for the Programmer
  • Create some base JCL to:
    • compile COBOL programs
    • run programs
    • do some basic functions

item.title: Update the RPi and the MVS-TK5 System
item.description:
If you installed MVS-TK5 per the instructions:

  • Shutdown MVS-TK5.
  • The Hercules console is not required for this task.

The RPi 3 Model B+ is a Quad Core so it has “4 CPUs”.

In this installation, the MVS-TK5 system is the only thing that is running on the RPi, so let’s update it.

With MVS-TK5 System NOT Running

To use the Hercules utilities:

Run uname -m to determine the architecture of your computer.

item.title: Add a new USER
item.description:
In this task, add a new User “DSCOBOL” with the Password “DCOB” as a regular User (not a System Programmer).

Step 1

Add the new User to SYS1.SECURE.CNTL(USERS)

Per the User Manual, the USERIDs must be in alphabetical order.

This is an example of adding DSCOBOL to USERS.

Step 2

IF

the MVS-TK5 System is already running in console_mode and you have access to the console:

    At the console prompt, enter
        `/stop RAKF`
        `/start RAKF`

You should see a message that the User Table has been reloaded.

ELSE

item.title: Create a starting structure
item.description:
When a new User is added with ADDUSER, the Job creates some PDSs for the new User.

They are: (using DSCOBOL as an example)

├── DSCOBOL.CMDPROC
├── DSCOBOL.EXEC
├── DSCOBOL.TEST.ASM
├── DSCOBOL.TEST.CNTL
├── DSCOBOL.TEST.LOADLIB

These are created on the TSO Volumes.

This MVS-TK5 System

Different systems have different structures; this is what this will be:

├── DSCOBOL.BASE.COBOL
├── DSCOBOL.BASE.COPYLIB
├── DSCOBOL.BASE.JCL
├── DSCOBOL.BASE.LOADLIB
├── DSCOBOL.BASE.PROCLIB

ALLOCATE will create these PDSs on the DSCOB1 Volume.

item.title: Create some base JCL
item.description:
SIMPLE is an example of a very simple Job to compile and run a simple COBOL program.

Upload or type this JCL into a new Member in DSCOBOL.BASE.JCL.

item.description:
//HERC01A JOB  (TSO),
//             'Add TSO users',
//             CLASS=A,
//             MSGCLASS=H,
//             COND=(0,NE),
//             MSGLEVEL=(1,1)
//*********************************************************************
//*
//* Name: SYS2.JCLLIB(ADDUSER)
//*
//* Desc: Add new TSO users
//*
//* Note: The newly created userids do not have a password set
//*       This jobs deletes the existing datasets with &HLQ !!!!
//*
//*********************************************************************
//*
//ADDUSER EXEC ADDUSER,HLQ=DSCOBOL,UTYPE=USER

item.title: An example of USERS
item.description:
************************************************
*                                              *
* RAKF user definitions for TK5                *
*                                              *
************************************************
DSCOBOL  USER     DCOB     N
*
FTPD     FTPD     FTPPW    N
* HERC01 is authorized for everything including RAKF update
*
HERC01   ADMIN   *CUL8TR   Y
HERC01   RAKFADM  CUL8TR   Y
*
* HERC02 is authorized for everything except RAKF update
*
HERC02   ADMIN    CUL8TR   Y
*
* herc03 and HERC04 are regular users
*
HERC03   USER     PASS4U   N
HERC04   USER     PASS4U   N
*
* IBMUSER is authorized for everything except RAKF update
*
IBMUSER  ADMIN    IBMPASS  Y
*
